[c4d5]

The bishop exchange on d5 immediately punishes the premature fianchetto. After 5.Bxd5 Black must recapture with the queen or knight, loosening his central grip and exposing the queen to later tempo-gaining threats (e.g. possible Nxe5 tactics). The subsequent open c-file and strong knight outposts on d5 and e5 compensate for the lost bishop pair, so I grab the favorable central light-square clamp before castling.
